main_definition: A payment made for a service or privilege, often used in various contexts such as professional services, intellectual property rights, public utilities, etc.

meanings_and_examples.example: The company paid a $2000 fee to have their financial statements audited by an independent firm.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Payment required for the use of intellectual property (e.g., copyright, patent)
meanings_and_examples.example: The author received a royalty fee each time his book was sold.
Residents are required to pay a monthly water and sewerage fee to the local government.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Fee paid by students attending an event or program
meanings_and_examples.example: Attendees were asked to pay a $10 registration fee for the conference workshop they wanted to participate in.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Cost associated with processing legal documents (e.g., court fees)
meanings_and_examples.example: The couple had to pay a filing fee of $300 when registering their marriage license at the courthouse.
